posts.post_content:
In a void, this guy's probably a better game-ender for artifact decks than [Master of Etherium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Etherium) since he's got evasion. Still, I'd say this is the worse card (not to say it's bad by any means). For comparison:  
  
**[Broodstar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Broodstar)**:  
Harder to chump block (either should kill anything in its path a few turns in, flying or no)  
Possible to cast for UU  
Having a high CMC is useful in [a](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacrifice) [few](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=43530) [cases](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=2440)  
  
**[Master of Etherium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Etherium)**:  
3 CMC, can be played for U with two [Etherium Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculptor) (why *wouldn't* you run those in an artifact deck?) - basically it's always going to be cheaper  
Very easy turn 2 3/3 or 4/4, racking up early damage  
For the above reasons, much more useful against aggro decks, since you can start picking off their weenies quickly and easily  
Can be tutored out on turn 5 with ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
In a void, this guy's probably a better game-ender for artifact decks than Master of Etherium since he's got evasion. Still, I'd say this is the worse card (not to say it's bad by any means). For comparison:

Broodstar:
Harder to chump block (either should kill anything in its path a few turns in, flying or no)
Possible to cast for UU
Having a high CMC is useful in a few cases

Master of Etherium:
3 CMC, can be played for U with two Etherium Sculptor (why wouldn't you run those in an artifact deck?) - basically it's always going to be cheaper
Very easy turn 2 3/3 or 4/4, racking up early damage
For the above reasons, much more useful against aggro decks, since you can start picking off their weenies quickly and easily
Can be tutored out on turn 5 with ... (see all)

Posted By: Lyoncet (2/27/2011 8:04:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Played with the correct cards and Broodstar can become a nightmare for the opponent. The artifact lands from Mirrodin, the borderposts from Alara Reborn, and the mana accelerant myrs from Mirrodin, all have enough synergy potential to allow Broodstar access into play as early as turn four, with a power/toughness total of at least five.
posts.html:
Played with the correct cards and Broodstar can become a nightmare for the opponent. The artifact lands from Mirrodin, the borderposts from Alara Reborn, and the mana accelerant myrs from Mirrodin, all have enough synergy potential to allow Broodstar access into play as early as turn four, with a power/toughness total of at least five.

posts.post_content:
I love inverse efficiency spells. The less you pay, the better the spell. For a more recent example, look at [Blasphemous Act](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blasphemous Act). I'll use the same argument here, you will NEVER, EVER pay that full cost on this guy. It will always be ![9](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=9&type=symbol) or less.  
  
  
Still, it's funny to realize this is a ![8](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=8&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) 0/0 creature that does nothing outside of artifact decks, not that anyone would ever play it like that.
posts.html:
I love inverse efficiency spells. The less you pay, the better the spell. For a more recent example, look at Blasphemous Act. I'll use the same argument here, you will NEVER, EVER pay that full cost on this guy. It will always be or less.


Still, it's funny to realize this is a 0/0 creature that does nothing outside of artifact decks, not that anyone would ever play it like that.

Posted By: CuriousThing (10/24/2011 8:18:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @boday1 Clearly you haven't used the Metallic Dreams deck that comes with one of these in it. The deck is packed with artifacts with 2 CMC, most with the ability to be tapped for mana. Plus the fact that there are artifact lands as well which assist in getting this card out as early as possible. I dare say this is a lot better than [Master of Etherium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Etherium) in the right situation, with the only downside of not boosting other artifact creatures. But Master of Etherium is in the deck to fill that role out nicely.

Posted By: Migelino64 (6/1/2011 12:24:01 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"Of course, if you're going heavy artifacts, what's to stop you from running both?"*   
   
Deck space. Honestly, how many absurdly-large creatures are required to win the game? A playset of MoE is the absolute most you'll need.
  
   
It's pretty clear that Master of Etherium is the better candidate, unless you forgot that competitive players gave up on Broodstar Affinity shortly after the release of *Darksteel*.
posts.html:
"Of course, if you're going heavy artifacts, what's to stop you from running both?"

Deck space. Honestly, how many absurdly-large creatures are required to win the game? A playset of MoE is the absolute most you'll need.

It's pretty clear that Master of Etherium is the better candidate, unless you forgot that competitive players gave up on Broodstar Affinity shortly after the release of Darksteel.
